Function Documentation

char* _sanitize_char ( char  output,
char *  message_array 
)

Sanitize a char result so as not to be a crazy character that crashes the XML parser.

Parameters:
output the char to be sanitized
message_array the array to write the message to
Returns:
the message formatted, either with the char or with a message saying the char is invalid

char* _sanitize_string ( char *  output_string  ) 

Sanitize a string result so as not to be a crazy character that crashes the XML parser.

Parameters:
output_string the string to be sanitized, which will have invalid characters replaced with '~'
Returns:
the output_string array formatted, invalid characters replaced with '~'

int assert_equals_callback ( const char *  msg,
void *  ptr1,
void *  ptr2,
int(*)(void *, void *)  compare 
)

Test if the two pointers match based on the compare function pointer passed; This function is best used to compare specific types of structs; If doesn't match, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
ptr1 the pointer that is expected
ptr2 the output pointer produced by the student's function
compare the function to call to compare the two pointers
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed

int assert_equals_char ( const char *  msg,
char  char1,
char  char2 
)

Test if the two char values match; If doesn't match, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
char1 the expected char
char2 the char produced by the student's output
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed

int assert_equals_char_array ( const char *  msg,
char  arr1[],
char  arr2[],
int  length 
)

Test if the char arrays match up to a certain length; If doesn't match, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
arr1 the char array that is expected
arr2 the char integer array produced by the student's function
length the length of the arrays to test
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed

int assert_equals_double ( const char *  msg,
double  double1,
double  double2,
double  accuracy_range 
)

Test if the two double values match; If doesn't match, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
double1 the expected double
double2 the double produced by the students test code
accuracy_range the difference between produced and expected must be less than this for the test to pass
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed

int assert_equals_double_array ( const char *  msg,
double  arr1[],
double  arr2[],
int  length,
double  accuracy_range 
)

Test if the double arrays match up to a certain length; If doesn't match, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
arr1 the double array that is expected
arr2 the double array produced by the student's function
length the length of the arrays to test
accuracy_range the difference between expected and student-produced must be less than this to pass
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed

Returns:

int assert_true ( const char *  msg,
int  boolean_expression 
)

Test if the given int evaluates to true in a 'if' statement; If doesn't evaluate to true, fail the test and report the error.

Parameters:
msg the message to print once the test has failed
boolean_expression the int expression to test
Returns:
0 if the test has an error, 1 if the test completed
